bestBHT.bht: There is One who seeks the honor and glory of Jesus, judging between him and those who oppose him. Jesus does not seek his own glory, but rather the glory that comes from God. The Father judges between Jesus and his enemies, and Jesus is confident in leaving his reputation in God's hands. As followers of Jesus, we also should seek the glory of God and be willing to bear reproach, knowing that God will judge between us and those who dishonor or oppose us.

Henry Alford: Ye dishonour me;—not that I seek my own honour, but His who sent me.
There is One who seeketh my honour and will have me honoured.
Who judgeth between me and you, between truth and falsehood.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: I seek not mine own glory: there is one that seeketh—that is, evidently, 'that seeketh My glory'
Requiring 'all men to honor the Son even as they honor the Father'
But giving to Him such as will yet cast their crowns before His throne
Albert Barnes: He did not seek to exalt or to vindicate himself.
God will take care of my reputation.
If we have a good conscience, if we are conscious that we are seeking the glory of God, we should be willing...to bear reproach.
Marvin Vincent: There is one that seeketh. That seeks my honor and judges between me and my opposers.
Philip Schaff: But I seek not my glory: there is one that seeketh and judgeth.
He will not protest against the dishonour they offer Him: His cause is in the Father’s hand.
The Father is deciding, and will decide between His enemies and Himself.
Archibald T. Robertson: But I seek not mine own glory.
It is only the δοξα (glory) that comes from God that is worth having.
The Father judges between you and me, though the Son is the Judge of mankind.
John Gill: he was not over solicitous of his own character
he committed himself to God that judgeth righteously
God his Father, who had his glory at heart
John Wesley: I seek not my own glory... For my Father consulteth it."
As I am the Messiah, I consult not my own glory."
I need not [seek my own glory], for my Father consulteth it.

bhtAttempts.bht: Though Jesus was being dishonored, He did not seek His own glory but rather the glory of the One who sent Him. He recognized that there is someone who seeks His honor and judges between Him and those who oppose Him. It is not about His reputation, but about the glory that comes from God. Jesus knew that the Father would judge between Him and His enemies, and He did not need to defend Himself in the face of dishonor. He trusted in God, who judges righteously.

Though Jesus was being dishonored, He did not seek His own glory but rather the glory of the One who sent Him. He recognized that there is someone who seeks His honor and judges between Him and those who oppose Him. It is not about His reputation, but about the glory that comes from God. Jesus knew that the Father would judge between Him and His enemies, and He did not need to defend Himself in the face of dishonor.

There is One who seeks the honor and glory of Jesus, judging between him and those who oppose him. Jesus does not seek his own glory, but rather the glory that comes from God. The Father judges between Jesus and his enemies, and Jesus is confident in leaving his reputation in God's hands. As followers of Jesus, we also should seek the glory of God and be willing to bear reproach, knowing that God will judge between us and those who dishonor or oppose us.

There is One who seeks the honor and glory of Jesus, judging between him and his opponents. Jesus, however, does not seek his own glory, but the glory that comes from God. The Father is the one who judges between Jesus and his enemies, while Jesus remains confident and committed, trusting God to handle his reputation. As followers of Jesus, we too should prioritize seeking the glory of God and be willing to endure reproach, knowing that God is the ultimate judge between us and those who dishonor or oppose us.

Jesus declares that he does not seek his own glory, but rather the glory of the One who sent him. There is One who seeks his honor and will have him honored, acting as a judge between him and those who oppose him. As followers of Jesus, we should also prioritize seeking the glory of God, being willing to endure reproach and trusting in God's judgment. The Father is the righteous judge who decides between Jesus and his enemies, and Jesus confidently entrusts his reputation to God's hands.
